p: However, a large number of physical processes, both regional and larger scales, are known to play important role in the dynamics of CIM 1 32 33 34; it is thus a difficult task to assign exact reasons for the failure in simulating satisfying the twin criteria. While aerosol and other anthropogenic forcings 35 may be major drivers of the trends, the roles of the dynamical processes need to be investigated first. We have next considered the following indices ( Fig. S1, Table 3) in terms of correlation coefficients (CC) between CIM rainfall and (a) sea surface temperature (SST) anomalies over NINO3.4 region (ENSO-CIM index), (b) Land equator thermal gradient over South Asia (LETG-SA index), (c) deep tropospheric thermal difference (DTTD index), (d) Land equator thermal gradient over India (LETG-IND index) and (e) difference in east-west SST difference (IOD index). The +ve/âˆ’ve index means the relationship between interannual variability of CIM rainfall and regional/large-scale climate indicators.
